text:
Amos Adams Lawrence (July 31, 1814August 22, 1886), the son of philanthropist Amos Lawrence, was an important person in the United States abolition movement shortly before the Civil War. He was important in building the University of Kansas in Lawrence, Kansas and Lawrence University in Appleton, Wisconsin.
Life.
Lawrence was born in Groton, Massachusetts or Boston on July 31, 1814.
He died at his summer resort in Nahant, Massachusetts.
Abolitionism.
Lawrence gave a lot of money to the New England Emigrant Aid Company because he did not want slavery. He gave guns to Jayhawkers to help them fight in the Civil War.
Personal life.
He died at his summer resort in Nahant, Massachusetts.
